intro: Lappula semnanensis, commonly known as the Semnan lappula, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Lappula semnanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
